title: Plain form と思います
explanation: The particle と is used with 思います to indicate ideas, opinions, or conjectures.

examples.japanese: あした雨が降ると思います。
examples.english: I think it will rain tomorrow.

examples.japanese: テレサちゃんはもう寝たと思います。
examples.english: I think Teresa has already gone to bed.

examples.japanese: ミラーさんはこのニュースを知っていますか。
examples.english: Does Mr. Miller know this news?

answer.japanese: ･･･いいえ、たぶん知らないと思います。
answer.english: No, I don’t think he does.

examples.japanese: 日本は物価が高いと思います。
examples.english: I think that prices are high in Japan.

examples.japanese: 新しい空港についてどう思いますか。
examples.english: What do you think of the new airport?

answer.japanese: ･･･きれいですが、ちょっと交通が不便だと思います。
answer.english: ...I think that it is clean but the access to it is not easy.

examples.japanese: A: ファクスは便利ですね。
examples.english: Fax machines are convenient, aren’t they?

examples.japanese: B: わたしもそう思います。
C: わたしはそうは思いません。

title: 「S」plain form } と言います
explanation: The particle と is used with 言います to quote speech. Direct or indirect quotation is possible.

examples.japanese: 寝るまえに「お休みなさい」と言います。
examples.english: We say 'Good night' before going to bed.

examples.japanese: ミラーさんは「来週東京へ出張します」と言いました。
examples.english: Mr. Miller said 'I will go to Tokyo on a business trip next week.'

examples.japanese: ミラーさんは来週東京へ出張すると言いました。
examples.english: Mr. Miller said that he would go to Tokyo on a business trip next week.

title: V / い-adj} な-adj / N } Plain form } でしょう?
explanation: Used with rising intonation to confirm the listener’s agreement or knowledge.

examples.japanese: あしたパーティーに行くでしょう?
examples.english: You are going to the party tomorrow, aren’t you?

examples.japanese: 北海道は寒かったでしょう?
examples.english: It was cold in Hokkaido, wasn’t it?

answer.japanese: ･･･いいえ、そんなに寒くなかったです。

title: N1 (place)でN2があります
explanation: When N₁ expresses events like concerts, parties, disasters, etc., あります means 'to be held' or 'to take place'.

examples.japanese: 東京で日本とブラジルのサッカーの試合があります。
examples.english: A football game between Japan and Brazil will be held in Tokyo.

title: N (occasion)で
explanation: When some action takes place on a certain occasion, that occasion is followed by で.

examples.japanese: 会議で何か意見を言いましたか。
examples.english: Did you give your opinion at the meeting?

title: Nでも V
explanation: でも gives an example out of things of the same kind, often in suggestions or encouragement.

examples.japanese: ちょっとビールでも飲みませんか。
examples.english: Shall we drink beer or something?

title: Vない-form ないと...
explanation: This is a shortened form of Vないといけません, meaning 'have to'. Similar to Vない-form なければなりません.

examples.english: I have to go home now.
